channel.description: Recent content in Partners on Security365 Docs

item.title: Hexnode
item.description: Deploy WARP using Hexnode ​​ Windows Requirements A 64-bit machine with Windows 10 or Windows 8 184 MB hard disk space and 3 MB memory Wi-Fi or LAN connection Create a script file with .bat, .cmd, and .ps1 file formats to download, install and configure the Cloudflare WARP client Windows application on the device. Listed below is a sample script with all of the configurable parameters: <# Choose file name for downloading application #> $filename = filename.

item.title: Intune
item.description: Deploy WARP using Intune ​​ Windows ​​ Prerequisites Download the Cloudflare_WARP_Release-x64.msi installer. ​​ Configure Intune for Windows Log in to your Microsoft Intune account. Navigate to Apps > All Apps > +Add. In App type, select Line-of-business app from the drop-down menu. Click Select. Click Select app package file and upload the Cloudflare_WARP_Release-x64.msi installer you downloaded previously. Click OK. In the Name field, we recommend entering the version number of the package being uploaded.

item.title: Jamf
item.description: Deploy WARP using Jamf ​​ macOS ​​ Prerequisites Download the Cloudflare_WARP.pkg file Create a plist file ​​ 1. Upload the WARP package Log in to your Jamf External link icon Open external link account. Navigate to Computer > All Settings (gear icon). Click Computer Management > Packages > New. Upload the Cloudflare_WARP.pkg file. For the Display name, we recommend entering the version number of the package being uploaded. Click Save to complete the upload.

item.title: JumpCloud
item.description: Deploy WARP using JumpCloud ​​ Windows Log in to the JumpCloud Admin Portal External link icon Open external link . Navigate to Device Management > Software Management. Select the Windows tab, then click (+). In the Software Name field, enter a unique display name. In the Package ID field, enter warp. Select Install this software. (Optional) Select Keep software package up to date to automatically update this app as updates become available.

item.title: Kandji
item.description: Deploy WARP using KandjiKandji deploys Cloudflare WARP as a custom app. For an overview of how Kandji deploys custom apps, refer to their knowledge base article External link icon Open external link . ​​ macOS For the simplest deployment, Kandji has created a downloadable configuration profile that enables Cloudfare WARP’s user notifications and configures its Privacy Preference Policy Control ( PPPC External link icon Open external link ) to have Full Disk Access.
